subject: Re: The simplest thing that could possibly work. WAS: [junit] Test-friendly, but not caller-friendly?
msgSnippet: ... I think it s easy. Start with fewer lines of code as a measure of simplicity. When you get to the first counterexample, add the next ingredient... Take
messageBody:
Joakim Ohlrogge wrote:

> How do you use the rule "the simplest thing that could possibly work?"
> I think it is hard to argue witht someone else that "this is simpler
> than that" but you can keep /yourself/ from doing things in a more
> complicated manner than absolutely necessary.

I think it's easy. Start with "fewer lines of code" as a measure of
simplicity. When you get to the first counterexample, add the next
ingredient...

Take care.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
